comment: In a graph, the neighborhood relation is symmetric: a vertex ` N ` in a graph ` G ` is a neighbor of a second vertex ` K ` iff the second vertex ` K ` is a neighbor of the first vertex ` N ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 27-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 12-Feb-2022.)
